result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyray L Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with anyone who possesses, uses or sells illegal drugs.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

from Defendant to Judge Ehlers re: DNA surcharge and sentence credit. Per Court, denied - surcharge imposition mandatory. Mr. Robinson was in custody either in Brown Co. or prison during the pendency of this case. He got credit in his Brown Co. case or cases - no credit here.
Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force payment of costs request

Defendant Tyray L Robinson in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, charge, max. penalties, receipt of PSI and recommendation contained therein. State makes sentencing recommendation. Court reviews letters from Defendant's family members. Defense makes sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
from Agent Larsen re: PSI
to transport

Defendant Tyray L Robinson in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding request for updated PSI. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State requests update on PSI prepared in Brown County case. Court orders updated PSI. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
to Transport

Defendant Tyray L Robinson appeared by video conference from Dodge Correctional Institution. Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer appared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant wants to resolve case as quickly as possible, but some discovery is still missing. State to prepare writ. Bond continues as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
